meanings.definition: The cell body of a neuron, containing the nucleus and other organelles.
meanings.sent1: The cyton is like the brain of the neuron, controlling its functions.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the cyton to understand how nerve cells work in the body.
meanings.sent3: The cyton threw a party for all the other organelles in the neuron.
meanings.sent4: Her cyton shone brightly with energy, like a tiny sun in the neuron universe.
meanings.sent5: The cyton is the command center, directing all activities within the neuron.

meanings.definition: A type of nerve cell found in the central nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The cyton in the central nervous system helps transmit signals to the brain.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are researching the cyton to better understand nerve cell functions.
meanings.sent3: The cyton in the brain told jokes to the other nerve cells, making them laugh.
meanings.sent4: His cyton was a conductor orchestrating the symphony of nerve impulses.
meanings.sent5: In the vast network of nerve cells, the cyton stands as a vital player.
